title: From John O'Groats to Land's End; Or, 1372 miles on foot; A book of days and chronicle of adventures by two pedestrians on tour
author: Naylor, John Anderton
snippet: Near these, on the bank of the river, was a largestone named the "Popping Stone," where it was said that Sir Walter Scott"popped the question," and all who can get a piece of this stone, which,by the way, is of a very hard nature, and place it under the pillow atnight, will dream of their future partners.

title: From John O'Groats to Land's End; Or, 1372 miles on foot; A book of days and chronicle of adventures by two pedestrians on tour
author: Naylor, John Anderton
